basics.name: Eric Gu
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: PhD Student in Anthropology at UC Irvine, studying political social media influencers in the US

work.name: Freelance Translator
work.summary: I have worked as an in-house and freelance translator between English and Chinese (Simplified) for near a decade. Rather than simply translating a message literally, my emphasis is on enriching interpretations of works by localizing them with different cultural contexts in mind.
highlights: Translated, localized, proofread, and conducted LQA using industry standard CAT tools, specializing in video games
Localized multiple well-known AAA and mobile video games
Consulted and facilitated communication between Chinese and English-speaking divisions of companies to improve efficiency and avoid cultural misunderstandings.

work.name: Northeastern University Communication Media and Marginalization Lab
work.summary: Undergraduate research position studying and applying computational social science methods at a network science lab studying marginalization.
highlights: Learned and assisted in data collection and network analysis for multiple studies
Coded for quantitative studies of political discourse on Twitter

work.name: Boston College Language Learning Lab
work.summary: Six month full-time co-op internship assisting with multiple projects and operations at a cognitive science lab on language acquisition.
highlights: Implemented designs for online MTurk experiments using Python and HTML+Javascript
Taught research assistants programming in R and Python for analysis of large data sets
Re-organized lab wiki and file management system for efficient workflow
